title: Calories in 1 Cup Green Beans
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 cup green beans, including carbs, fiber, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with quick tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Fresh green beans, cooked (boiled or steamed), drained; approximately 125 g per cup; no added salt, oil, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by variety (fresh, frozen, canned), preparation method, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of cooked green beans provides about 44 kcal and 4 g of dietary fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Sautéed with 1 tsp olive oil per cup

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 cup of cooked green beans?
faqs.a: About 44 kcal for 1 cup of plain cooked green beans.

faqs.q: Are green beans low in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 cup has 10 g carbs, with 4 g fiber, making net carbs about 6 g.

faqs.q: What is the protein content in 1 cup green beans?
faqs.a: Approximately 2.4 g of protein per cup.

faqs.q: Do green beans have any fat?
faqs.a: Very low—only 0.3 g total fat per cup, with negligible saturated fat.

faqs.q: How does preparation affect calories in green beans?
faqs.a: Boiled/steamed keeps it low (44 kcal/cup); frying or adding oil/butter increases it significantly.
